titleInfo.title: A&I Instructor due to return to India as Agricultural Advisor, Nashville, Tennessee, 1958 August 28

mods.identifier: Banner 1958-2412 Jones family to India Aug23 1958 Goodman 001

location.physicalLocation: Metropolitan Nashville/Davidson County Archives, Nashville Public Library

mods.abstract: Caption from Nashville Banner, August 28th, 1958: “The Harold M. Jones family delightedly watch little Carlotta Jones, 3, finger a massive tiger head their father shot as they make preparations to return to India Sept. 1 for another year. Another daughter, Estrella, 7, holds a deer head trophy from India.” Mr. Jones, an instructor in agricultural engineering at Tennessee A&I University, spent two years in Central India, Madha, Pradah, as advisor on establishment of a farm machinery training center. He was asked by the Indian Government to return via a program sponsored by the International Cooperation Administration, which is a part of the U. S. Mutual Aid Program. Forms part of Nashville Banner Negatives Collection. 1 photographic negative : b & w ; 4 x 5 in.
mods.accessCondition: U.S. and international copyright laws protect this digital content, which is provided for educational purposes only and may not be downloaded, reproduced, or distributed for any other purpose without written permission.
